bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 166, Number 19 (Wednesday, January 29, 2020)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. TIPTON:H.R. 5714.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:section 8 of article I of the Constitution[Page H713]

latestAction.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Armed Services.

item.name: Wilderness and natural areas, wildlife refuges, wild rivers, habitats

summary.text:
Safeguarding Readiness in Military Aviation Training Act

This bill requires the Department of Defense to report on the impacts that the expansion of wilderness designations in the western United States would have on the readiness of the Armed Forces with respect to aviation training.

bill.title: Safeguarding Readiness in Military Aviation Training Act

item.title: Safeguarding Readiness in Military Aviation Training Act

To direct the Secretary of Defense to conduct a study on the impacts that the expansion of wilderness designations in the Western United States would have on the readiness of the Armed Forces of the United States with respect to aviation training, and for other purposes.
Safeguarding Readiness in Military Aviation Training Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Armed Services.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
